history.proof: intros H. apply supM. intros x Hx. apply poset_trans with (y := sup s2). - apply supP. qsimpl time: 1. - qsimpl time: 1 use: relaxP.

exceptions.exn: In environment T : lattice s1, s2 : Pred T H : s1 <=p s2 x : T Hx : x \\In s1 Unable to unify "x \\In s1" with "x \\In s2".
Unable to find an instance for the variable P1.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: lattice
s2: Pred T
s1: Pred T

Goal:
s1 <=p s2 -> sup s1 <== sup s2

Premises:
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
Notation sup := @Lattice.sup
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?T' : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?f : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- ?T'] ?s : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- seq ?T]
Mem_cat : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), x \In s1 ++ s2 < -> x \In s1 \/ x \In s2
In_split : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq_PredType T), x \In s -> exists s1 s2 : seq T, s = s1 ++ x :: s2
supP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== sup s
supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> sup s <== x
sup_closed = fun T : lattice => [Pred s | forall d : Pred_Class, d <=p s -> sup d \In s] : forall T : lattice, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments sup_closed {T}
lbot = fun T : lattice => sup Pred0 : forall T : lattice, T Arguments lbot {T}
cat = fun T : Type => fix cat (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => x :: cat s1' s2 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Arguments cat {T}%type_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
subp_trans : forall (T : Type) (p2 p1 p3 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p3 -> p1 <=p p3
subp_asym : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p1 -> p1 =p p2
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
subp_orl : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> PredU p1 q <=p PredU p2 q
subp_orr : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> PredU q p1 <=p PredU q p2
poset_trans : forall (T : poset) (y x z : T), x <== y -> y <== z -> x <== z
Record mixin_of (T : poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_sup : Pred T -> T; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x } Arguments Lattice.Mixin [T] [mx_sup]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope
Image_inj_sub : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] <=p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 <=p X2
relaxP : forall (T : poset) (P1 P2 : T), P1 <== P2 -> forall p : T, p <== P1 -> p <== P2
Lattice.poset = fun cT : lattice => Poset.Pack (Lattice.class cT) cT : lattice -> poset Lattice.poset is a coercion
subp_or : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p q /\ p2 <=p q < -> PredU p1 p2 <=p q
Lattice.Pack : forall sort : Type, Lattice.class_of sort -> Type -> lattice
poset_asym : forall (T : poset) (x y : T), x <== y -> y <== x -> x = y
Lattice.sort = fun t : lattice => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : lattice -> Type Lattice.sort is a coercion
Lattice.sup = fun cT : lattice => [eta Lattice.mx_sup (Lattice.mixin (Lattice.class cT))] : forall cT : lattice, Pred cT -> cT Arguments Lattice.sup {cT}
subp_and : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), q <=p p1 /\ q <=p p2 < -> q <=p (fun x : T => p1 x /\ p2 x)
subp_andl : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> (fun x : T => p1 x /\ q x) <=p (fun x : T => p2 x /\ q x)
subp_andr : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> (fun x : T => q x /\ p1 x) <=p (fun x : T => q x /\ p2 x)
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
subp_refl : forall (T : Type) (p : Pred T), p <=p p
infM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> x <== y) -> x <== inf s
Lattice.clone : forall (T : Type) (cT : lattice) (c : Lattice.class_of T), phant_id (Lattice.class cT) c -> lattice

```coq
intros H. 
apply supM. 
intros x Hx. 
apply poset_trans with (y := sup s2). 
- apply supP. 
  exact Hx. 
- apply relaxP. 
  + apply subp_refl. 
  + apply subp_trans with (p2 := s1). 
    * exact H. 
    * apply subp_andl. 
      apply subp_refl. 
Qed.
```

original: intros H. apply supM. intros x Hx. apply poset_trans with (y := sup s2). - apply supP. apply Hx. - apply relaxP. + apply subp_refl. + apply subp_trans with (p2 := s1). * apply H. * apply subp_andl. apply subp_refl.
